meanings.definition: The skin of an animal with the fur or hair still on it.
meanings.sent1: The hunter collected the pelts of the rabbits he caught.
meanings.sent2: The furrier specialized in working with various animal pelts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the rabbit pelt, thinking it was alive.
meanings.sent4: The pelts of the animals in the forest told stories of survival and adaptation.
meanings.sent5: The softness of the fox pelt made it a prized possession.

meanings.definition: To strike repeatedly, usually with something hard or heavy.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith pelts the metal to shape it into a sword.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the hail pelts the roof with force.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they pelting each other with snowballs.
meanings.sent4: The rain pelts the ground, creating a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The angry waves pelting the shore with relentless fury.

meanings.definition: To move quickly and with determination.
meanings.sent1: The athlete pelts towards the finish line, leaving his competitors behind.
meanings.sent2: The courier pelts through the crowded streets to deliver the package on time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel pelts up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The car pelts down the highway, racing against time.
meanings.sent5: The rain pelts against the window, urging everyone to stay indoors.
